newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH CHEMAPOL SAYS GDRS ON HOLD.
newsitem.headline: CZECH CHEMAPOL SAYS GDRS ON HOLD.

text.p: Czech chemical and industrial holding Chemapol Group a.s. said on Thursday its plan to issue global depositary receipts (GDR) would most likely not materialise before the end of this year.

"We expect we will enter the international markets. The GDR issue will be realised at the end of this year or later," the company's chairman Vaclav Junek told a presentation to analysts and jouralists.
He added that Chemapol could convert existing shared into GDRs, eventhough the original plan last year was a minimum 600 million crown new issue.
The chairman said the firm planned to issue two to three billion crowns worth of bonds in a three-year issue, replacing existing issue which is coming due later this year.

The company said it expected its unconsolidated gross profit for 1996, before provisions, to be 658 million crowns, but in a statement said this would be lowered by some 300 to 350 million depending on reserves to d.
In 1995, the company had 62.5 million consolidated net profit. Comparative figures for unconsolidated profit were not available.
Junek said equity capial reached 2.5 billion crowns after a recent rights issue from 1.68 billion, and the company did not need to expand the basic capital at the moment.
Junek said the firm had spent about 12 billion crowns on acquisitions in the recent years and in 1996 "we invested about six or seven billion, that was the last and the largest wave,"

He said payment for acquisitions made in the buying spree for the group -- which now includes major chemical companies, a small airline, a publishing house, an arms trading firm and sports franchises and clubs -- were not paid off immediately.
He did not elaborate on what payments were outstanding.

Junek said six newly-created subholdings, dealing with chemichal, communications, trading, distribution, real estate, and defence industry, will gradually take over all daughter companies currently owned by the holding.
